API package¶

Submodules¶

API.main module¶

API.main.allowed_file(filename)¶

Helper method to verify if file is of a csv format

Parameters

filename (string) – name of provided file

Returns

Boolean denoting if file name contains the csv file type

API.main.createPrediction(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Trigger the creation of a new prediction

Parameters

  • areaid – Id of area from which to create a prediction

  • date – date of prediction to create

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 and the prediction id if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.deleteDropStrategy(dropid=None)¶

Deletes a specific drop strategy

Parameters

dropid – ID of drop strategy to delete

Returns

API.main.deleteExperiment(experimentid=None)¶

Route to delete an experiment

Parameters

experimentid – Id of experiment to delete

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the number of experiments deleted if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.deleteNest(nestid=None)¶

Deletes a specified nest

Parameters

nestid – ID of the nest to delete

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful, the number of nests deleted

API.main.deleteNestConfiguration(nestconfigid=None)¶

Deletes a Nest Configuration

Parameters

nestconfigid – ID of nest config to delete

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the number of entries deleted if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.deleteServiceArea(areaid=None)¶

Edits a specified nest configuration’s vehicle qty

Parameters

areaid – ID of service area to update

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the number of entries updated if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.deleteUser(userid=None)¶

Route to delete users from the database. User will be identified with the userid in the URI route.

Parameters

userid – ID of the user to delete

Returns

if request is successful, will return a response object with the number of deleted documents with format: { “ok”: { “deleted”: number_of_documents_deleted } }

if error in request, will return a 400, 404, 500 or 405 error with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

API.main.editDropStrategy(dropid=None, daynum=None)¶

Edit the configurations of a drop strategy. Nest configurations are part of an array on the drop strategy, the daynum parameter denotes the index of that array to replace with a new list of nest configurations

Parameters

  • dropid – ID of drop strategy to edit

  • daynum – number of the day of the configurations that will be replaced

Returns

Number of drop strategies edited

API.main.editDropStrategyName(dropid=None)¶

Edit a drop strategy name

Parameters

dropid – ID of drop strategy to edit

Returns

API.main.editDropStrategyVehicles(dropid=None)¶

Edit the number of vehicles set for a drop strategy

Parameters

dropid – ID of drop strategy to edit

Returns

API.main.editExperiment(experimentid=None)¶

Route to edit experiments name

Parameters

experimentid – Id of experiment to edit

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the number of edited experimetns if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.editNest(nestid=None)¶

Edit Nest name of specified nest id

Parameters

nestid – ID of nest to modify

Return:if request was valid

response object with status code 200 containing number of Nest modified. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404,304, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.findNestConfiguration(nestconfigid=None)¶

Finds Nest configurations identified by provided nest configuration id

Parameters

nestconfigid – ID of nest configuration to find

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the requested nest configuration if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.findNestConfigurationsForNest(nestid=None)¶

Finds Nest configurations for a specified nest

Parameters

nestid – ID of nest from which to look for nest configurations

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the requested nest configurations. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.getAllServiceAreas()¶

Route to get all Service areas in the database.

Returns

if request is successful, will return a response object with the id of the inserted object with format: { “ok”:[ { “_id”: id of service area, “area_name”: name of service area, “coords”: { “coordinates”: [ [-67.152729,18.2176116], …], “type”: “LineString” } }, ] } if error in request, will return a 400, 404, 500 or 405 ststus code with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

API.main.getAllUsers()¶

Route to get all users registered in the system

:return:if request is successful (status code 200), will return a response object with the information of all Users

in the database. Response will have the format: [ { “_id”: document_id, “email”: user_email, “type”: user_type }, ] if error in request, will return a 400, 404, 500 or 405 status code with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

API.main.getDropStrategiesForArea(areaid=None)¶

Get drop strategies for a specific area

Parameters

areaid – ID of area from which to get drop strategies

Returns

response object with drop strategy info requested

API.main.getDropStrategyForDate(areaid=None, sdate=None, edate=None)¶

Gets a drop strategy between two dates. Intended so the request will receive all drop strategies between the specified start and end date

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area that drop strategy belongs to

  • sdate – start date of drop strategy to find

  • edate – end date of drop strategy to find

Returns

API.main.getDropStrategyFromID(dropid=None)¶

Get a specific drop strategy

Parameters

dropid – ID of the drop strategy to take

Returns

response object with drop strategy info requested

API.main.getEmptyNestsForDate(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to get nests that were empty on a specific area and date, as well as how much time they remained empty.

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area from which to get nests

  • date – date of the day from which to retrieve empty nests.

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the requested nest information. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

Route to get an experiment from a provided ID

Parameters

experimentid – ID of experiment to retreive

Return:if request was valid

response object with status code 200 containing the experiment requested if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.getExperimentsForAreaID(areaid=None, userid=None)¶

Gets experiments related to an area ID

Parameters

  • userid – ID of user. Needed to retrieve Nests that belong to that user

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the experiments requested if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

  • userid – ID of users that own the nests

  • date – date that denotes the limit from which to get the latest drop strategy

Returns

API.main.getNest(nestid=None)¶

Get a specific Nest characterized by a nest id. if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing Nest identified by provided id will be returned. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message will be returned.

Parameters

nestid – ID of Nest to find

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful, the information on the nest requested

Returns

API.main.getNestsName(userid=None, areaid=None)¶

Get Nest Names of Service Area specified. if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing Nest names on area specified wil lbe returned. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

Parameters

  • userid – ID of user that created said Nests

  • areaid – ID of area to get Nests from

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful, the nests names on the area requested

API.main.getNestsOnAreaByUser(userid=None, areaid=None)¶

Get Nests on Service Area specified. if request was valid a response object with status code 200 containing Nests on area specified will be returned. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

Parameters

  • userid – ID of user that created said Nests

  • areaid – ID of area to get Nests from

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful, the nests on the area requested.

  • date – date of prediction to retreive

  • areaid – Id of area from which to get predictions

  • date – date of prediction to retreive

Parameters

experimentid – Id of experiment to take report from

Returns

Statistics for the configurations on the report

API.main.getRequierments(areaid=None)¶

Trigger the creation of a new prediction

Parameters

  • areaid – Id of area from which to create a prediction

  • date – date of prediction to create

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 and the prediction id if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message ok: { “can_train”: False, “required_days”: 0, “Accuracy”: 0.69, “Threshold”: 0.4 }

API.main.getRidesCoordinates(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to get coordinates of rides for a specified area on a specified day. /api/nestmatics/rides/coords/area/<areaid>/date/<date>

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area to get rides from

  • date – date on which rides happened

Returns

json containing coordinates of rides that meet the specified criteria

API.main.getRidesEndingAtNest(nestid=None, date=None, areaid=None)¶

Get Rides that end at specified Nest (nestid) on a specified date on a specified area. /api/nestmatics/rides/endat/nest/<nestid>/date/<date>/hour/<hour>/area/<areaid>

Parameters

  • nestid (string) – ID of nest that indicated location from where desired rides started

  • date (string) – date when desired rides happened

  • areaid (string) – ID of area to get rides from

Returns

json containing all rides that meet the specified criteria

API.main.getRidesForDateAndArea(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to get coordinates of rides for a specified area on a specified day (/api/nestmatics/rides/area/<areaid>/date/<date>)

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area to get rides from

  • date – date on which rides happened

Returns

json containing information requested

API.main.getRidesForTimeInterval(areaid=None, date=None, starttime=None, endtime=None)¶

Route to get rides that happen on a specified area, date and between a specified interval of time. /api/nestmatics/rides/interval/area/<areaid>/date/<date>/start/<starttime>/end/<endtime>

Parameters

  • endtime (string) – end time of interval from which to get rides

  • starttime (string) – end time of interval from which to get rides

  • areaid (string) – ID of area to get rides from

  • date (string) – date on which rides happened

Returns

json containing all rides that happened on the specified parameters.

API.main.getRidesStartingAtNest(nestid=None, date=None, areaid=None)¶

Get Rides that start at specified Nest (nestid) on a specified date on a specified area /api/nestmatics/rides/startat/nest/<nestid>/date/<date>/area/<areaid>

Parameters

  • nestid (string) – ID of nest that indicated location from where desired rides started

  • date (string) – date when desired rides happened

  • areaid (string) – ID of area to get rides from

Returns

json containing all rides that meet the specified criteria

API.main.getRidesStats(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to get ride stats for a specified date and area. if request was valid: response object with status code 201 containing JSON with rides stats if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message. /api/nestmatics/stats/area/<areaid>/date/<date>

Parameters

  • areaid (string) – ID of area to get stats from

  • date (string) – date from which to get ride stats

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful ,ride stats for the day

API.main.getServiceArea(areaid=None)¶

Route to retrieve service area information identified by the areaid used as parameter

Parameters

areaid – ID of the service area to request

Returns

if request is successful (status code 200), will return a response object with the information of requested user. Response will have the format: { “_id”: id of service area, “area_name”: name of service area, “coords”: { “coordinates”: [ coordinates of service area ], “type”: (optional) type of polygon coordinates }

if error in request, will return a 400, 404, 500 or 405 status code with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

API.main.getTotalActiveVehicles(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to only get the total active vehicles according to rides stats stored for an area on a specific date. Active vehicles are the vehicles that did rides on a specific day. Not evey vehicle deployed has rides on a day. if request was valid: response object with status code 201 containing JSON with the total active vehicles if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message /api/nestmatics/stats/activevehicles/area/<areaid>/date/<date>

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area from which to obtain the total active vehicles

  • date – date from which to retreive the total active vehicles

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful, the active vehicles for the specified day

API.main.getTotalNumberOfRides(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to only get the number of rides according to rides stats stored for an area on a specific date. if request was valid: response object with status code 201 containing JSON with number of rides if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message. /api/nestmatics/stats/ridesnum/area/<areaid>/date/<date>

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area from which to obtain number of rides

  • date – date from which to retreive the total number of rides

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful, the number of rides for the specified day

API.main.getTotalRevenue(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to only get the total revenue according to rides stats stored for an area on a specific date if request was valid: response object with status code 201 containing JSON with the total revenue for provided area and date. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with an error message

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area from which to obtain the total revenue

  • date – date from which to retrieve the total revenue

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful, total revenue for the specified day

API.main.getUnusedVehiclesForNest(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to get the amount of vehicles unused on the nests of a particular day and area

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area from which to get the unused vehicles

  • date – data from which to get the unused vehicles

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 containing the requested nest information. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.getUser(userid=None)¶

Route to get a specific user’s information from the database

Parameters

userid – User ID of a specific user

Returns

if request is successful (status code 200), will return a response object with the information of requested user. Response will have the format: { “_id”: document_id, “email”: user_email, “type”: user_type } if error in request, will return a 400, 404, 500 or 405 ststus code with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

API.main.getWeatherData(areaid=None, date=None)¶

Route to get weather data from a specified location on a specified date

Parameters

  • areaid – ID of area requested weather belongs to

  • date – date of requested weather information

Returns

response object with weather data

API.main.getrideDatesForArea(areaid=None)¶

Route to get dates available with ride data for a specified service area /api/nestmatics/rides/area/<areaid>/alldates

Parameters

areaid – ID of service area to get rides from

Returns

json containing a lit of dates with ride data

API.main.getrideDatesForAreaAndInterval(areaid=None, startdate=None, enddate=None)¶

Route to get dates available with ride data for a specified service area and on a specified time interval /api/nestmatics/rides/area/<areaid>/start/<startdate>/end/<enddate>/alldates

Parameters

  • areaid (string) – ID of area to get rides from

  • startdate (string) – date on which rides happened

  • enddate (string) – date on which rides happened

Returns

json containing a lit of dates with ride data

API.main.home()¶

Dummy Route to verify of server is up and able to connect to the backend

Returns

string with message which confirms connection

Return type

string

API.main.insertDummyData()¶
API.main.insertUser()¶

Route to insert a user in the system

Returns

if request is successful, will return a response object with the id of the inserted object with format: { “ok”: { “_id”: id_Number } } ** id_Number refers to the db id for the newly inserted field

if error in request, will return a 400, 404, 500 or 405 error with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

API.main.postDropStrategy()¶

Route to insert a drop strategy in the system

:return:if request is successful, will return a response object with the id of the inserted object with

format: { “ok”: { “_id”: id_Number } } ** id_Number refers to the db id for the newly inserted field if error in request, will return a 400, 403, 404, 500 or 405 error with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

API.main.postExperiment()¶

Route to insert a user in the system

Returns

if request is successful, will return a response object with the id of the inserted object with format: { “ok”: { “_id”: id_Number } } ** id_Number refers to the db id for the newly inserted field if error in request, will return a 400, 404, 500 or 405 error with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

API.main.postNestConfigurations()¶

Route to insert a new Nest Configuration into the database

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 201 containing the id of newly entered document. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message

API.main.postNests()¶

Route to insert Nests into the database. if request was valid a response object with status code 201 containing JSON with id of new nest will be returned. if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message.

Returns

response object containing a status code and, if succesful, the id of the nest inserted

API.main.postRides()¶

Route to insert Rides from a provided csv file in the request body. if request was valid: response object with status code 201 containing JSON with inserted rides IDs, skipped rides and the ids of stats entry for the uploaded days if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 500 or 405 along with json with error message.( /api/nestmatics/rides )

Returns

Response object with ids of inserted rides, skipped rides and ids of the stats entry for the day.

API.main.postServiceArea()¶

Route to insert a Service Area in the database. Service Area to be inserted should have the following structure: { “_id”: id of service area, “area_name”: name of service area, “coords”: { “coordinates”: [ coordinates of service area], “type”: (optional) type of polygon coordinates }

Return:if request is successful, will return a response object with the id of the inserted object with format

{ “ok”: { “_id”: id_Number } } ** id_Number refers to the db id for the newly inserted field

if error in request, will return a 400, 404, 500 or 405 error with corresponding information, following the format: { “Error”: “error information string” }

Route to trigger the training of a new ML model

Parameters

areaid – ID of area from which to create a model

Returns

API.main.trainModel(areaid=None)¶

Route to trigger the training of a new ML model

Parameters

areaid – ID of area from which to create a model

Returns

API.main.validate_all(areaid=None)¶

Trigger the creation of a new prediction

Parameters

  • areaid – Id of area from which to create a prediction

  • date – date of prediction to create

Returns

if request was valid: response object with status code 200 and the prediction id if request was invalid: response object with status code 400, 404, 500 or 405 along with json with error message ok: { “can_train”: False, “required_days”: 0, “Accuracy”: 0.69, “Threshold”: 0.4 }
